intro: Stenoptera ecuadorana, commonly known as the Ecuadorian stenoptera, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andean regions of Ecuador. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded environments, often in cloud forests. Its botanical features include lance-shaped leaves with serrated edges and white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in the spring. Stenoptera ecuadorana is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
